required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multicenter Study of the Pigmentation in the Trabecular Meshwork After Two Years of Treatment With TRAVATAN 0.004% Ophthalmic Solution
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Study of the Pigmentation in the Trabecular Meshwork After Two Years of Treatment With TRAVATAN 0.004% Ophthalmic Solution

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to assess the pigmentation in the trabecular meshwork of patients who had been treated for at least 2 years with TRAVATAN compared with patients without exposure (or less than 1 month) to a prostaglandin analogue (PGA).

primary_outcome.description: A trabecular meshwork tissue sample was collected by the investigator. The number of pigment granules was counted for three separate microscopic fields of view. Mean melanin granule count was calculated.

arm_group.description: As prescribed by physician for the treatment of open-angle glaucoma and dosed for at least two years
No prior exposure (or less than 1 month) to any topical, ocular prostaglandin analogue

intervention.description: A minimum of two punches were used to remove tissue to form a sclerostomy. Tissue removed by the punch was collected for analysis. Alternatively, the tissue was collected by block excision of the meshwork with scissors at the time of sclerostomy.

study_pop.textblock: Patients were identified and enrolled from 9 study centers in the US and 1 in Spain.
